intro: Stylocoryna adpressa, commonly known as the flatleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, fleshy leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Stylocoryna adpressa thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
